id.Description: The resource id

kind.Description: Indicates the type of database account. This can only be set at database account creation.

properties.Description: Properties to create and update Azure Cosmos DB database accounts.

location.Description: The location of the resource group to which the resource belongs.

tags.Description: Tags are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource. These tags can be used in viewing and grouping this resource (across resource groups). A maximum of 15 tags can be provided for a resource. Each tag must have a key no greater than 128 characters and value no greater than 256 characters. For example, the default experience for a template type is set with "defaultExperience": "Cassandra". Current "defaultExperience" values also include "Table", "Graph", "DocumentDB", and "MongoDB".

consistencyPolicy.Description: The consistency policy for the Cosmos DB database account.

locations.Description: An array that contains the georeplication locations enabled for the Cosmos DB account.

databaseAccountOfferType.Description: The offer type for the Cosmos DB database account.

ipRangeFilter.Description: Cosmos DB Firewall Support: This value specifies the set of IP addresses or IP address ranges in CIDR form to be included as the allowed list of client IPs for a given database account. IP addresses/ranges must be comma separated and must not contain any spaces.

isVirtualNetworkFilterEnabled.Description: Flag to indicate whether to enable/disable Virtual Network ACL rules.

enableAutomaticFailover.Description: Enables automatic failover of the write region in the rare event that the region is unavailable due to an outage. Automatic failover will result in a new write region for the account and is chosen based on the failover priorities configured for the account.

capabilities.Description: List of Cosmos DB capabilities for the account

virtualNetworkRules.Description: List of Virtual Network ACL rules configured for the Cosmos DB account.

enableMultipleWriteLocations.Description: Enables the account to write in multiple locations

enableCassandraConnector.Description: Enables the cassandra connector on the Cosmos DB C* account

connectorOffer.Description: The cassandra connector offer type for the Cosmos DB C* database account.

provisioningState.Description: The status of the Cosmos DB account at the time the operation was called. The status can be one of following. 'Creating' – the Cosmos DB account is being created. When an account is in Creating state, only properties that are specified as input for the Create Cosmos DB account operation are returned. 'Succeeded' – the Cosmos DB account is active for use. 'Updating' – the Cosmos DB account is being updated. 'Deleting' – the Cosmos DB account is being deleted. 'Failed' – the Cosmos DB account failed creation. 'Offline' - the Cosmos DB account is not active. 'DeletionFailed' – the Cosmos DB account deletion failed.

documentEndpoint.Description: The connection endpoint for the Cosmos DB database account.

writeLocations.Description: An array that contains the write location for the Cosmos DB account.

readLocations.Description: An array that contains of the read locations enabled for the Cosmos DB account.

failoverPolicies.Description: An array that contains the regions ordered by their failover priorities.

defaultConsistencyLevel.Description: The default consistency level and configuration settings of the Cosmos DB account.

maxStalenessPrefix.Description: When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the number of stale requests tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 1 – 2,147,483,647. Required when defaultConsistencyPolicy is set to 'BoundedStaleness'.

maxIntervalInSeconds.Description: When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the time amount of staleness (in seconds) tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 5 - 86400. Required when defaultConsistencyPolicy is set to 'BoundedStaleness'.

id.Description: The unique identifier of the region within the database account. Example: <accountName>-<locationName>.

documentEndpoint.Description: The connection endpoint for the specific region. Example: https://<accountName>-<locationName>.documents.azure.com:443/

provisioningState.Description: The status of the Cosmos DB account at the time the operation was called. The status can be one of following. 'Creating' – the Cosmos DB account is being created. When an account is in Creating state, only properties that are specified as input for the Create Cosmos DB account operation are returned. 'Succeeded' – the Cosmos DB account is active for use. 'Updating' – the Cosmos DB account is being updated. 'Deleting' – the Cosmos DB account is being deleted. 'Failed' – the Cosmos DB account failed creation. 'Offline' - the Cosmos DB account is not active. 'DeletionFailed' – the Cosmos DB account deletion failed.

failoverPriority.Description: The failover priority of the region. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions - 1). Failover priority values must be unique for each of the regions in which the database account exists.

isZoneRedundant.Description: Flag to indicate whether or not this region is an AvailabilityZone region

name.Description: Name of the Cosmos DB capability. For example, "name": "EnableCassandra". Current values also include "EnableTable" and "EnableGremlin".

id.Description: Resource ID of a subnet, for example: /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{groupName}/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/{virtualNetworkName}/subnets/{subnetName}.

ignoreMissingVNetServiceEndpoint.Description: Create firewall rule before the virtual network has vnet service endpoint enabled.

id.Description: The unique identifier of the region in which the database account replicates to. Example: <accountName>-<locationName>.

locationName.Description: The name of the region in which the database account exists.

failoverPriority.Description: The failover priority of the region. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions - 1). Failover priority values must be unique for each of the regions in which the database account exists.

id.Description: The resource id

properties.Description: Properties to create and update Azure Cosmos DB SQL database.

location.Description: The location of the resource group to which the resource belongs.

tags.Description: Tags are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource. These tags can be used in viewing and grouping this resource (across resource groups). A maximum of 15 tags can be provided for a resource. Each tag must have a key no greater than 128 characters and value no greater than 256 characters. For example, the default experience for a template type is set with "defaultExperience": "Cassandra". Current "defaultExperience" values also include "Table", "Graph", "DocumentDB", and "MongoDB".

resource.Description: Cosmos DB SQL database id object

options.Description: CreateUpdateOptions are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource. Supported keys are "If-Match", "If-None-Match", "Session-Token" and "Throughput"

_colls.Description: A system generated property that specified the addressable path of the collections resource.

_users.Description: A system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the users resource.

id.Description: Name of the Cosmos DB SQL database

_rid.Description: A system generated property. A unique identifier.

_etag.Description: A system generated property representing the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

id.Description: Name of the Cosmos DB SQL database
The resource id

tags.Description: Tags are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource. These tags can be used in viewing and grouping this resource (across resource groups). For example, the default experience for a template type is set with "defaultExperience": "Cassandra". Current "defaultExperience" values also include "Table", "Graph", "DocumentDB", and "MongoDB".

throughput.Description: Value of the Cosmos DB resource throughput

id.Description: The resource id

properties.Description: Properties to create and update Azure Cosmos DB container.

location.Description: The location of the resource group to which the resource belongs.

tags.Description: Tags are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource. These tags can be used in viewing and grouping this resource (across resource groups). A maximum of 15 tags can be provided for a resource. Each tag must have a key no greater than 128 characters and value no greater than 256 characters. For example, the default experience for a template type is set with "defaultExperience": "Cassandra". Current "defaultExperience" values also include "Table", "Graph", "DocumentDB", and "MongoDB".

resource.Description: Cosmos DB SQL container resource object

options.Description: CreateUpdateOptions are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource. Supported keys are "If-Match", "If-None-Match", "Session-Token" and "Throughput"

id.Description: Name of the Cosmos DB SQL container

partitionKey.Description: The configuration of the partition key to be used for partitioning data into multiple partitions

uniqueKeyPolicy.Description: The unique key policy configuration for specifying uniqueness constraints on documents in the collection in the Azure Cosmos DB service.

conflictResolutionPolicy.Description: The conflict resolution policy for the container.

_rid.Description: A system generated property. A unique identifier.

_etag.Description: A system generated property representing the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

id.Description: Name of the Cosmos DB SQL container

partitionKey.Description: The configuration of the partition key to be used for partitioning data into multiple partitions

uniqueKeyPolicy.Description: The unique key policy configuration for specifying uniqueness constraints on documents in the collection in the Azure Cosmos DB service.

conflictResolutionPolicy.Description: The conflict resolution policy for the container.

automatic.Description: Indicates if the indexing policy is automatic

includedPaths.Description: List of paths to include in the indexing

excludedPaths.Description: List of paths to exclude from indexing

path.Description: The path for which the indexing behavior applies to. Index paths typically start with root and end with wildcard (/path/*)

indexes.Description: List of indexes for this path

dataType.Description: The datatype for which the indexing behavior is applied to.

precision.Description: The precision of the index. -1 is maximum precision.

path.Description: The path for which the indexing behavior applies to. Index paths typically start with root and end with wildcard (/path/*)

paths.Description: List of paths using which data within the container can be partitioned

kind.Description: Indicates the kind of algorithm used for partitioning

uniqueKeys.Description: List of unique keys on that enforces uniqueness constraint on documents in the collection in the Azure Cosmos DB service.

paths.Description: List of paths must be unique for each document in the Azure Cosmos DB service

conflictResolutionPath.Description: The conflict resolution path in the case of LastWriterWins mode.

conflictResolutionProcedure.Description: The procedure to resolve conflicts in the case of custom mode.

shardKey.Description: The shard key and partition kind pair, only support "Hash" partition kind

shardKey.Description: The shard key and partition kind pair, only support "Hash" partition kind

key.Description: Cosmos DB MongoDB collection resource object

options.Description: Cosmos DB MongoDB collection index options

keys.Description: List of keys for each MongoDB collection in the Azure Cosmos DB service

primaryMasterKey.Description: Base 64 encoded value of the primary read-write key.

primaryReadonlyMasterKey.Description: Base 64 encoded value of the primary read-only key.

secondaryReadonlyMasterKey.Description: Base 64 encoded value of the secondary read-only key.

connectionStrings.Description: An array that contains the connection strings for the Cosmos DB account.
